member.name: T:BrailleIO.BrailleIOMediator
member.summary: Central instance for the BrailleIO Framework. It connects the hardware abstraction layers and the GUI/TUI components. It gives you access to the hardware via the AdapterManager. The GUI/TUI components are available through several methods.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.BrailleIOMediator.RefreshDisplay(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tries to sent the actual build matrix to all devices, that are active. To enable a sending, the pins have to be unlocked (still rendering or maybe locked by the user) and at an Adapter has to be active.
member.param: if set to true the mediator will force a rendering of the content.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.BrailleIOMediator.RenderDisplay
member.summary: Forces the rendering thread to build the resulting Matrix by calling all renderer for the visible view ranges. The matrix will not been sent until the refresh timer is elapsed or the Method was called.

member.summary: separate thread for building the resulting matrix

member.name: P:BrailleIO.BrailleIOMediator.Instance
member.summary: Central instance for the BrailleIO Framework. It connects the hardware abstraction layers and the GUI/TUI components. It gives you access to the hardware via the AdapterManager. The GUI/TUI components are available through several methods.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.BrailleIOMediator.RenderingTimerInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering timer interval in milliseconds. Every tick of the timer the manager checks for changed content by the renderers and submit it to the adapters.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.BrailleIOMediator.MaxTicksToSynchronize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum ticks before starting a synchronization. If the has ticked this count times and the content wasn't changed yet, the matrix will be sent to all adapters anyway for refreshing them. The minimal refresh frequency is RenderingTimerInterval (ms) * MaxTicksToSynchronize.
member.value: The maximum ticks before starting a synchronization anyway.
member.exception: Tick count must be larger then 0

member.name: M:BrailleIO.BrailleIOViewRange.SetContrastThreshold(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the contrast threshold for image contrast rastering. If lightness of a color is lower than this threshold, the pin will be lowered. A higher threshold leads lighter points to raise pins. A low threshold leads darker pins to stay lowered. Threshold has to be between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.BrailleIOViewRange.GetContrastThreshold
member.summary: Gets the contrast for image contrast rastering. If lightness of a color is lower than this threshold, the pin will be lowered. A higher threshold leads lighter points to raise pins. A low threshold leads darker pins to stay lowered. Have to be between 0 and 255.

member.value: ViewBox of this view (position and size)

member.name: P:BrailleIO.BrailleIOViewRange.ContentBox
member.summary: Rectangle given dimensions and position of the view range or screen that can be used for displaying content. The position is the top-left position of ContentBox inside the viewRange. The size is the visible size inside the view range --> ViewBox size without margin, border and padding. BrailleIOScreen ViewBox ┌────────────────────────────────────────────────╱─┐ │ BrailleIOViewRange ╱ │ │╔═ Margin ════════════════════════════════════════╗│ │║ Border ║│ │║ Padding ║│ │║ ┌╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴┐ ║│ │║ │ │ ║│ │║ │ │ ║│ │║ │ │ ║│ │║ │ ContentBox │ ║│ │║ │ = space to present content │ ║│ │║ │ │ ║│ │║ │ │ ║│ │║ │ │ ║│ │║ └╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴╴┘ ║│ │║ ║│ │╚═════════════════════════════════════════════════╝│ │╔═════════════════════════════════════════════════╗│ │║ another BrailleIOViewRange ║│ │╚═════════════════════════════════════════════════╝│ └───────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

member.name: P:BrailleIO.BrailleIOViewRange.OffsetPosition
member.summary: Sets the offset position. This is the relation between the content's position to the visible view. This value is added to the contents positions to compute the points rendered to the output. Standard is 0,0 which is means, the content is started rendered in the top-left corner of the viewBox. To move the content to the top - which is something like a pan down - you have to set the y-position to a negative value. To move the content down, you have to add a positive offset. The same happens for horizontal movement. A negative value will move the content to the left - which is a pan to the right - and a positive value will move the content to the right.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.BrailleIOViewRange.Border
member.summary: Gets or sets the border.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.BrailleIOViewRange.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding. The padding is the inner space between the border and the content.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.BrailleIOViewRange.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin. The margin is the outer space around an area. Space between the objects and the border.

member.name: T:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOBorderRenderer
member.summary: render the border defined for an view range

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOBorderRenderer.RenderMatrix(BrailleIO.Interface.AbstractViewBorderBase,System.Boolean[0:,0:])
member.summary: Renders a content object into an boolean matrix; while true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins
member.param: The frame to render in. This gives access to the space to render and other parameters. Normally this is a .
member.returns: A two dimensional boolean M x N matrix (bool[M,N]) where M is the count of rows (this is height) and N is the count of columns (which is the width). Positions in the Matrix are of type [i,j] while i is the index of the row (is the y position) and j is the index of the column (is the x position). In the matrix true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOBorderRenderer.drawHorizontalLine(System.UInt32,System.Boolean[0:,0:]@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws the horizontal line.

member.name: T:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOImageToMatrixRenderer
member.summary: A renderer that translates an image into an bool matrix by applying a threshold on the lighness of a color pixel.

member.name: F:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOImageToMatrixRenderer.Threshold
member.summary: If lightness of a color is lower than this threshold, the pin will be lowered. A higher threshold leads lighter points to raise pins. A low threshold leads darker pins to stay lowered. Have to be between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOImageToMatrixRenderer.ResetThreshold
member.summary: Resets the threshold. If lightness of a color is lower than this threshold, the pin will be lowered. A higher threshold leads lighter points to raise pins. A low threshold leads darker pins to stay lowered. Have to be between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOImageToMatrixRenderer.SetThreshold(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the threshold. If lightness of a color is lower than this threshold, the pin will be lowered. A higher threshold leads lighter points to raise pins. A low threshold leads darker pins to stay lowered. Have to be between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOImageToMatrixRenderer.RenderMatrix(BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.param: The frame to render in. This gives access to the space to render and other parameters. Normally this is a .
if set to true [call the pre- and post-rendering hooks].
member.returns: A two dimensional boolean M x N matrix (bool[M,N]) where M is the count of rows (this is height) and N is the count of columns (which is the width). Positions in the Matrix are of type [i,j] while i is the index of the row (is the y position) and j is the index of the column (is the x position). In the matrix true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOImageToMatrixRenderer.ContentOrViewHasChanged(BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel,System.Object)

member.value: true if invert the image; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOViewMatixRenderer
member.summary: Place a content-matrix in a matrix that fits in a given view with aware of the BoxModel.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOViewMatixRenderer.RenderMatrix(BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel,System.Boolean[0:,0:])
member.summary: Puts the given content-matrix in a matrix that fits in the given view. The content-matrix placement is with aware of the given Box model and panning offsets. Borders are not rendered. If the content-matrix don't fit in the view, the overlapping content is ignored. If the content-matrix is smaller than the view, the rest is set to false. This renderer takes also care about the panning, which is set in the view if they is IPannable.
member.param: The view witch holds the BoxModel. If the view is IPannable than the offset is also considered.
The content matrix. Holds the content that should be placed in the view.
member.returns: a bool[view.ViewBox.Width,view.ViewBox.Height] matrix holding the content with aware of the views' BoxModel.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOViewMatixRenderer.RenderMatrix(BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel,System.Boolean[0:,0:],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Puts the given content-matrix in a matrix that fits in the given view. The content-matrix placement is with aware of the given Box model. Borders are not rendered. If the content-matrix don't fit in the view, the overlapping content is ignored. If the content-matrix is smaller than the view, the rest is set to false. This renderer takes also care about the panning, which is set in the view if they is IPannable.
member.param: The view with holds the BoxModel. If the view is IPannable than the offset is also considered.
The content matrix. Holds the content that should be placed in the view.
Handle the panning of the content matrix or not
member.returns: a bool[view.ViewBox.Width,view.ViewBox.Height] matrix holding the content with aware of the views' BoxModel.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleIOViewMatixRenderer.RenderMatrix(BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel,System.Object)
member.summary: Renders a content object into an boolean matrix; while true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins
member.param: The frame to render in. This gives access to the space to render and other parameters. Normally this is a .
member.returns: A two dimensional boolean M x N matrix (bool[M,N]) where M is the count of rows (this is height) and N is the count of columns (which is the width). Positions in the Matrix are of type [i,j] while i is the index of the row (is the y position) and j is the index of the column (is the x position). In the matrix true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Überschreibt die CurrentUICulture-Eigenschaft des aktuellen Threads für alle Ressourcenzuordnungen, die diese stark typisierte Ressourcenklasse verwenden.
